result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Lee Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $453 costs--TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Lee Edwards

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chad Lee Edwards in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 90 days Rock Co Jail; 10 consecutive days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $453 costs = TIME SERVED, 97 days sentence credit.  Refund bond posted.
Defendant Chad Lee Edwards in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Chad Lee Edwards in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
No contact with any Piggly Wiggly stores in Rock County
